t: By*pn the rivers of Babylon, There*ln we sat down and wept, When*ln we remembered Zion.
Upon*ln the willows in the midst of it We*ln hung our harps.
For*ln there our captors demanded of us songs, And*ln our tormentors mirth, saying,*i “Sing*ln us one of the songs of Zion.”
How*ln can we sing the Lord’s*s song In*ln a foreign land?
If*ln I forget you, O Jerusalem, May*ln my right hand forget her*i skill.*i
May*ln my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth If*ln I do not remember you, If*ln I do not exalt Jerusalem Above*ln my chief joy.
Remember,*ln O Lord,*s against the sons of Edom The*ln day of Jerusalem, Who*ln said, “Raze it, raze it To*ln its very foundation.”
O*ln daughter of Babylon, you devastated one, How*ln blessed will be the one who repays you With*ln the recompense with which you have repaid us.
How*ln blessed will be the one who seizes and dashes your little ones Against*ln the rock.
